title: Audit UI
content:
The Audit user interface (UI) is a standalone UI. This page gives an overview of the Audit UI.

 

For information on how to access the Audit UI, see Access the Audit UI.

Audit UI overview

When you successfully log in to the Audit UI, no records are selected by default. The Audit toolbar has the SYSTEM and TENANT tabs. Both the SYSTEM and TENANT tabs are visible on the toolbar. The SYSTEM tab gives the system view by listing the system level audits. The TENANT tab gives the tenant view by listing the tenant level audits. The user with VIEW_TENANT_LEVEL_AUDIT permissions will see the tenant related audit data only. The user with VIEW_SYSTEM_LEVEL_AUDIT permission will see the system related audit data only. If the user has both VIEW_SYSTEM_LEVEL_AUDIT and VIEW_TENANT_LEVEL_AUDIT permissions, then the user can view system and tenant level audit events. The tenant admin role has the permission to see both the system and tenant level audit events. The default view is the Tenant view in Service Management, and the System view is the default view in Suite Administration. 

The following table describes the different fields in the grid:

Field Description
Audit Time The time when the user or application triggers the event.
Event Category The type of events captured by the audit service. For example: Authentication, Authorization, Account, Configuration, and Operation.
Event Name The name of the event.
Actor The user (user ID) performing the action.
Action The type of operation. For example, creation or deletion.
Target The user (user ID) who gets impacted by the change.
Severity The level of impact of the event. For example, low, medium, high, and very high.
Result The result of the action. For example, success or failure.

Filters

You can find the Add filter button above the list of records. By default, the Audit UI will show the failed records for the past week. You can select one or more filters and values by which to filter the records. The following table shows the different filters and their values:

Filter Value
Action Create, Read, Update, Delete, or no value
Audit Time Today, Yesterday, Tomorrow, Past week, Past month, Past year, This month, Next week, or choose dates
Event Category Authentication, Authorization, , Account, Configuration, Operation, or no value
Result Success, Fail
Severity Low, Medium, High, Very High
Event Name Contains, Does not contain, Starts with, Ends with, is empty
Target Contains, Does not contain, Starts with, Ends with, is empty
Actor Contains, Does not contain, Starts with, Ends with, is empty

Text field filters

For free text fields, select the field, and select the Add icon and select one of the following options.

  • Contains: Displays text that contains a particular text.
  • Does not contain: Displays text that does not contain the mentioned text.
  • Starts with: Type free text in the text box and press Enter.
  • Is empty: Returns only records with no value in the text field.
  • Ends with: Type free text in the text box and press Enter.
 
Event Name, Target and Actor are text field filters.

 

 

Preview

When you select a record in the grid, the Preview pane on the right displays some details of the record. The following table provides a list of the fields in a preview:

Field Description
Event Name The name of the event.
Service The name of the service, for example, IdM.
Version The version of the service.
Event Category The type of events captured by the audit service.
Description Description of the event.
Audit Time The time when the user or application triggers the event.
Severity The level of impact of the event.
Tenant Id Tenant ID.
Source IP address of the source from where the event gets triggered.
Destination The service that's impacted by the event (Optional).
Actor The user (user ID) performing the action.
Target The user (user ID) that's impacted by the change.
Action The type of operation.
Result The result of the action.
Status

SUCCESS if all the required fields of the event are present.

WARNING if some fields are missing. You can see the missing fields here.

Export

You can find the Export to CSV button above the list of records. Click to download the audit records in CSV format. When no records are selected, the Export to CSV button remains disabled. You can export 10,000 records. If there are more than 10,000 records, the Export to CSV button gets disabled. If you hover on the button, you see this message:

Change your search criteria to enable the export as the total records has exceeded 10000 limit.

The downloaded file includes the data in the displayed columns, in the same sorted order, taking account of any filter applied.

Related topic

To know more about the Audit roles and permissions, see Audit roles and permissions.

To know more about the Audit events, see Audit events.
